Business and Management

Business theories have been developing over the last 100 years and theorists have attempted to make models of how business enterprises work and, in doing so, simplify the processes and present them in diagrams and illustrations for easier understanding. Some theories have been in place for many years and can be applied to many business areas such as human relations, leadership, marketing and systems analysis and are of essential value to managers in problemsolving in the real world. Using these theoretical models, your business knowledge can be applied but always with attention to the individual circumstances you are examining.

In studying business management issues, we also use case studies. These are narratives and explanations of events which took place in certain businesses in the past and that we can use to analyse decision making, the results of these decisions and propose other possibilities which would have had different results had they been implemented. These cases will help you to think in a business management way about the wider implications of your decisions which might occur both inside and outside a company, to understand the fast-moving world of business and to enjoy and learn from discussions with your peers.

Learning Objectives for this module:

+  Identify basic business structures and their functions.

+  Identify risk and major changes in the external business environment and assess the impact of these on business.

+  Analyse and discuss how managements make their choices regarding strategies and the theoretical models that help these to be implemented succesfully.

+  Analyse and discuss ways by which businesses can pursue their aims and objectives with effective management of resources including marketing, human resource management, finance and IT.

+  Provide a business critique of contemporary events, review the options available and recommend actions.
